title: Floyd Mayweather struggles to control tiger
title_page: Floyd Mayweather struggles to control tiger | Daily Mail Online
text:
Floyd Mayweather is famous for his cat-like reflexes in the ring but the boxing star was on the back foot in trying to control a tiger.
You read that correctly, Mayweather enjoyed the company of two tigers whilst his entourage watched on in awe.
In a video posted on Instagram, the 'Money man' petted the tiger before it attempts to wander off and drags the retired pugilist in it's wake.
Scroll down for video...
Floyd Mayweather was surrounded by his entourage whilst he petted a tiger
The undefeated American boxer eyes up the predator with an air of caution
Mayweather struggles to restrain the tiger as it tugs hard on the leash, pulling him with it
A white tiger is then brought in, though Mayweather does not risk holding onto two of the big cats simultaneously.
He is not the first boxing star to show an interest in big cats. Mike Tyson owned three Bengal tigers, costing him Â£57,000 each and famously made a cameo with a tiger in The Hangover.
Mayweather has displayed cat-like reflexes in defence throughout his decorated career and may need to call on them once more.
The 40-year-old has said he will come out of retirement for a mega-fight against UFC star Conor McGregor.
Mayweather is not the first boxer to take an interest in big cats and Mike Tyson is also a fan
There was also a rare white tiger brought in for the entertainment of the 'Money man'
A possible fight between the pair appears to be edging ever closer with UFC president Dana White insisting he will not stand in the way of negotiations.
This is a remarkable softening of approach from White who previously stated he was more likely to start the Superbowl as back-up quarterback than see the fight taking place.
If the highly anticipated contest does go ahead, Mayweather will be the one let off the leash for the 50th time and will have to become the predator once more.
